definition: Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing mountain/☶/ancient Chinese compass point: 45° (northeast)
wishing one could do sth/to hate to be unable/itching to do sth
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to nurse a grievance/to harbor a grudge
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
to hate out of jealousy/to resent

sentences.english: Pei pull the nan ning get in the car, act of parliament said pei to nan ning did not feel hate.
sentences.chinese: 沛拉着楠宁上车，帕莱说沛对楠宁没有恨的感觉。

sentences.english: If I tell you how I lost it you would hate me forever.
sentences.chinese: 如果我告诉你我是怎么弄丢的，你会恨我一辈子的。

sentences.english: Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.
sentences.chinese: 你们听见有话说，当爱你的邻舍，恨你的仇敌。

sentences.english: Budgeting is something that people either love or hate to do.
sentences.chinese: 编制预算对很多人来说是又爱又恨的事情。

sentences.english: Sweet feeling, fine company, hate springs not forever.
sentences.chinese: 甜沁泉，纤为伴，恨不成永远。

sentences.english: Dropping my broom, hate yelling to rise.
sentences.chinese: 我扔下扫帚，恨恨地大喊起来。

sentences.english: Dropping my broom, hate yelling to rise.
sentences.chinese: 我扔下扫帚，恨恨地大喊起来。

sentences.english: Hating, he sat there. And remembering.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在那里，一边恨，一边回忆。

sentences.english: Part of the problem is the state is very fragmented.
sentences.chinese: 该州这个问题有部分又恨支离破碎。

sentences.english: Hatred paralyzes life; love release it.
sentences.chinese: 恨使生活瘫痪无力，爱使他重获新生。

sentences.english: Although my heart is hate, but I still love you.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我心有余恨，但是我依旧爱你。

sentences.english: Start tup but look back, have no hate.
sentences.chinese: 惊起却回头，有恨无人省。

sentences.english: My sigh in the background as you pick out the cashews hates you.
sentences.chinese: 你采摘腰果的时候，我在后面的叹息声恨你。

sentences.english: Sometimes, it is better to remain unknown than to make pimple hate you.
sentences.chinese: 有时，保持默默无闻比让人恨你要好得多。

definition: to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to feel a mixture of love and hate
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
